availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Nathan Byrd (Caldwell co., ky, student)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, student. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Nathan C. Byrd and Sarah Jane Leeper Byrd. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Dry goods clerk employed by Nathan C. Byrd in Fredonia in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Fredonia in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 310A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 828.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 164.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 211B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #21997.
